channel.title: AI on Barnaby's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in AI on Barnaby's Blog

item.title: Argument against recent research on compressing text tokens using images in MLLMs
item.author: bwreford.contact@gmail.com (Barnaby Wreford)
item.description: TLDR: if you have a text input and want to compress the number of tokens fed to your decoder, use a text-based encoder, don’t render an image and use a visual encoder.

item.title: Generative AI Being Spooky and Strange
item.author: bwreford.contact@gmail.com (Barnaby Wreford)

item.title: High Dimension Vector Orthogonality and Superposition in LLMs
item.author: bwreford.contact@gmail.com (Barnaby Wreford)
item.description: If you’re interested in experimenting yourself with the topics in this post, you may want to check out the code I used to generate all the graphs and stats in the accompanying jupyter notebook.
